## FadingFeature.addRenderHelper() function

As three.js is rendering the transparent objects last (internally), regardless of their renderOrder value, we set the transparent value to false in the \[\[onAfterRenderCall\]\]. In \[\[onBeforeRender\]\], the function \[\[calculateDepthFromCameraDistance\]\] sets it to true if the fade distance value is less than 1.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
function addRenderHelper(object: THREE.Object3D, viewRanges: ViewRanges, fadeNear: number | undefined, fadeFar: number | undefined, updateUniforms: boolean, additionalCallback?: (renderer: THREE.WebGLRenderer, material: THREE.Material & FadingFeature) => void): void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  object | THREE.Object3D | \[\[THREE.Object3D\]\] to prepare for rendering. |
|  viewRanges | ViewRanges | The visibility ranges (clip planes and maximum visible distance) for actual camera setup. |
|  fadeNear | number \| undefined | The fadeNear value to set in the material. |
|  fadeFar | number \| undefined | The fadeFar value to set in the material. |
|  updateUniforms | boolean | If <code>true</code>, the fading uniforms are set. Not required if material is handling the uniforms already, like in a \[\[THREE.ShaderMaterial\]\]. |
|  additionalCallback | (renderer: THREE.WebGLRenderer, material: THREE.Material &amp; [FadingFeature](./harp-materials.fadingfeature.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; void | If defined, this function will be called before the function will return. |

<b>Returns:</b>

void
